title: Chat banned for trio reporting me for calling one of them a snowflake....
body:
Game 1
Pre-Game
TheMadBro: ad
In-Game
TheMadBro: don't knoiw if you noticed but I kidna can't
TheMadBro: they are hiding. mayb eyou should not be stupidly aggressive
TheMadBro: report zyra
TheMadBro: report zyra please. intentionally doing nothing
TheMadBro: i did'nt say passive. but enjoy 4x reports and possibly more from enemy also
TheMadBro: k. enjoy ban
TheMadBro: you relize that refusing to work with team is reportable lol
TheMadBro: zed are you duo with zyra?
TheMadBro: it does because he just assisted you in purosfully not helping team lol
TheMadBro: again, please report zyra
TheMadBro: gg. enjoy free win
TheMadBro: after how much yo'uve allowed them to get fed. obviously. he can 2 shot me
TheMadBro: now you are muted child
TheMadBro: clearly your ego is pathetically easy to hurt
TheMadBro: stop being a snowflake
TheMadBro: ch;ild
TheMadBro: that suicide just to ks me lol
TheMadBro: no thanks to these 3. they gotta be trio. malphite just suicided to ks me
TheMadBro: i have not inted all game. i've been doing my best with a zyra that purposefully stood and watched me die
TheMadBro: because his "feelings" got hurt when I said it's not my fault he died


Obviously, this chat history only shows my side and does not show how my support was intentionally leaving me to die, then would trash talk over and over until I finally muted him and his friend (turned out one who was silent was also in the trio). I would like to understand why the system cannot recognize when someone is being ganged up on by a group and how in the world does "child" and "Snowflake" constitute as being chat ban worthy? 
I truly miss the old Tribunal system when a reasonable person could view the entire chat and get some understanding of what was actually going on.

On my part: I stayed in the game in spite of playing with a horrible group. I did not intentionally feed and I tried my best. I endured name-calling, trash talk, teammates purposefully preventing me from getting CS, 3/4 teammates falling out of teamfights until I was killed off and then would try to 3v5 or 4v5.  This was all because the support got upset when he tower dove at level 3 and gave first blood while I did not follow him. So please explain how this system is helping me as a player? Or is it the word snowflake is somehow more offensive than the massive amount of cussing, swearing, religion bashing and other things that I report almost weekly and yet, never get a notice that those players are banned.

In a game about 2 months ago I wrote "lol, don't be a snowflake" to a guy who started cussing me out because I accidentally used my lucian ult in the wrong direction. I also got chat banned after that game... What makes this word so bad?

replies.body:
You: I got gang-reported and banned. 
Also You: I tried to get someone else gang-reported and banned. 

Most important note: The IFS does not count the number of reports. If there exists a single report, it will conduct a review. There is no distinction between 1 report and 9 reports. 

Less important note: Using the word snowflake was the least of your problems. 

Least important note: The old tribunal absolutely would have voted to punish this.

Asking people to report someone is harassment.

try not to argue with people.

justifed ban.
